Yes, you can also check the correlation between two features by calculating their correlation coefficient. The correlation coefficient measures the strength and direction of a linear relationship between two variables.

A correlation coefficient value of 1 indicates a perfect positive linear relationship, 0 indicates no linear relationship, and -1 indicates a perfect negative linear relationship.

You can use the `.corr()` method in pandas to calculate the correlation coefficient between two columns of a DataFrame. For example:
```python
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('avocado.csv')

# Calculate the correlation coefficient between total volume and average price
corr = df['Total Volume'].corr(df['AveragePrice'])

# Print the correlation coefficient
print('Correlation coefficient:', corr)
```
If the correlation coefficient is close to 1 or -1, it indicates a strong linear relationship between the two variables, whereas a value close to 0 indicates little or no linear relationship.
